greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of solid standard Young tableaux of shape [[n*k,n],[n]]; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: In general, column k is (for k > 1) asymptotic to sqrt((k+2)*(k^2 - 20*k - 8 + sqrt(k*(k+8)^3)) / (8*k^3)) * ((k+2)^(k+2)/k^k)^n / (Pi*n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 31 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
S. B. Ekhad, D. Zeilberger, Computational and Theoretical Challenges on Counting Solid Standard Young Tableaux, arXiv:1202.6229v1 [math.CO], 2012
maple: b:= proc(x, y, z) option remember; `if`(z>y, b(x, z, y), `if`(z>x, 0,
mathematica: b [x_, y_, z_] := b[x, y, z] = If[z > y, b[x, z, y], If[z > x, 0, If[Union[{x, y, z}] == {0}, 1, If[x > y && x > z, b[x-1, y, z], 0] + If[y > 0, b[x, y-1, z], 0] + If[z > 0, b[x, y, z-1], 0]]]]; a[n_, k_] := b[n*k, n, n]; Table[Table[a[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 8}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 29 2012
